metadata.title: CVE-2021-46934 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:i2c: validate user data in compat ioctlWrong user data may cause warning in i2c_transfer(), ex: zero msgs.Userspace should not be able to trigger warnings, so this patch addsvalidation checks for user data in compact ioctl to prevent reportedwarnings

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
